New Records: The referee showed 18 cards in total, two red and 16 yellow, to set a new Euros record.
Key Match Events: Tomás Soucek scored in the 66th minute to equalize for Czechia
Cenk Tosun scored in stoppage time to give Turkey the win
Antonín Barák was given a harsh second yellow card and red card in the 20th minute
Tomás Chorý was also given a red card in a melee at the final whistle
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams pressed hard from the start in a raucous atmosphere on a hot night
Turkish fans outnumbered the Czechs thanks to their huge diaspora in Germany
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Tomás Soucek said the 'disrespectful' soft red card had affected the game
Turkey winger Baris Alper Yilmaz said they kept their promise to get out of the group
Czechia captain Tomás Soucek lamented the sad end to the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Turkey set up a Euro 2024 last-16 clash with Austria and sent their opponents home
Turkey finished second behind Portugal in Group F on goal difference
Czechia finished bottom of the group with one point
